4. Anomaly Detection
▪ Identify observations whose characteristics are significantly 
different from the rest of the data
– Such observations are called anomalies or outliers
outlier
▪ Goal
– Discover the real anomalies and 
avoid falsely labeling normal objects 
as anomalous
• A high detection rate
• A low false alarm rate
▪ Application examples
– The detection of fraud, network intrusions, unusual patterns of disease, 
and ecosystem disturbances (e.g., droughts, floods, fires, hurricanes)
